Chapter Two [Grace]66-sam Glancing around [the gallery]212-the gallery , [I]0-i could n’t help but grin . [[My]0-i best friend]217-my best friend walked through the door , ignoring [the people buzzing about everywhere]218-the people buzzing about everywhere , and came straight over to [me]0-i . “ [You]0-i know [you]0-i ’re not [the painter]1854-the painter , right ? ”[68-harper] [Harper]68-harper asked , looking [me]0-i up and down . “ [I]0-i ’m touching up the walls where they ’re scuffed , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , holding a can of white paint and a paintbrush . “ And [I]0-i do n’t want [you]217-my best friend resting on [your]217-my best friend laurels . ”[0-i] [I]0-i nodded toward a broom in the corner . “ [We]1855-we do n’t have long . Get busy . ”[0-i] [I]0-i needed the first exhibition in [[my]0-i newly opened gallery]219-my newly opened gallery to go well . [I]0-i was prepared , but the adrenaline racing through [my]0-i veins had [me]0-i jumpy . [I]0-i glanced around [the large white space]220-the large white space . [The catering staff]221-the catering staff were in the process of setting up and two pictures still rested against the walls . “ [I]0-i need to decide where to hang those , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , putting down the paint by the door and pointing at the two paintings . “ But [I]0-i ca n’t decide where [they]1856-they should go . ”[0-i] Yesterday , the order had seemed so obvious . Today [I]0-i kept changing [my]0-i mind — [I]0-i wanted everything to be perfect . “ Does it matter ? ”[68-harper] [Harper]68-harper asked , [her]68-harper face totally blank . “ [We]1857-we do n’t want [his]222-the artist i was featuring this evening shitty work to sell anyway , do [we]1857-we ? ”[68-harper] [I]0-i chuckled and a layer of stress lifted from [my]0-i body . Chapter Four Grace [I]0-i stood outside [the building [I]0-i ’d grown up in]410-the building i ’d grown up in , this time at [the goods delivery entrance]411-the goods delivery entrance , waiting for [the van with [Mr. Shaw]76-mr. shaw ’s paintings]412-the van with mr. shaw ’s paintings to arrive . [He]69-steve ’d switched so easily and effortlessly [I]0-i wondered if [he]69-steve ’d ever had any real feelings for [me]0-i . [We]418-we ’d been dating exclusively for over nine months . Chapter Twenty - Three [Sam]66-sam “ Coming , ”[0-i] [I]0-i shouted at the pounding against [[my]0-i hotel room]1654-my hotel room door . Chapter Twenty - Four [Grace Sam]66-sam ’s gift was so unnecessary . All [I]0-i wanted was [him]1694-his — to see in [his]1694-his expression that [he]1694-his still loved [me]0-i . Back to [us]1696-us . “ Please , [Grace]66-sam , just open it . ”[0-i] [I]0-i kneeled and slid the string off the brown paper . The edges were hard , like a frame . Just a glimpse of the frame told [me]0-i what [he]66-sam ’d done . Tears began to roll down [my]0-i face as [I]0-i revealed the canvas . How did [you]66-sam find — oh , [Sam]66-sam , the cost . ”[0-i] “ Shhh , please do n’t think about it . It was always [yours]66-sam . And so was [I.]66-sam ”[66-sam] “ [You]66-sam know , it ’s funny , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , looking up at [him]66-sam . “ [I]0-i always thought [I]0-i ’d get it back one day . A bit like [you]66-sam , [Sam Shaw]66-sam . ”[0-i] “ But . . . ”[66-sam] [His]66-sam mouth fell open as [he]66-sam struggled to find the words . “ [I]0-i do n’t need the big speeches and the expensive paintings — just [you]66-sam . [I]0-i only ever needed [you]66-sam , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . [I]0-i hate being without [you]66-sam . ”[0-i] [His]66-sam hand curled around [mine]0-i and [he]66-sam pulled [me]0-i toward [him]66-sam . “ [You]0-i never have to be .
